remarks: Lemma for ~ sylow3 , second part.  Using the lemma ~ sylow2a , show that the number of sylow subgroups is equivalent ` mod P ` to the number of fixed points under the group action.  But ` K ` is the unique element of the set of Sylow subgroups that is fixed under the group action, so there is exactly one fixed point and so ` ( ( # `` ( P pSyl G ) ) mod P ) = 1 ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)
statement:

sylow3.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. Prime ) $.
sylow3lem5.a $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.

sylow3lem5.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( P pSyl G ) ) $.
sylow3lem5.m $e |- .(+) = ( x e. K , y e. ( P pSyl G ) |-> ran ( z e. y |-> ( ( x .+ z ) .- x ) ) ) $.
sylow3lem6.n $e |- N = { x e. X | A. y e. X ( ( x .+ y ) e. s <-> ( y .+ x ) e. s ) } $.
sylow3lem6 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( # ` ( P pSyl G ) ) mod P ) = 1 ) $.
